Verification-First Verilog Module Bring-Up

[2026.02.15]

I try to validate behavior before polishing implementation details. For student projects, this keeps logic drift under control when requirements evolve quickly.

Bring-up checklist

  1. Lock interface assumptions (clk, rst_n, handshake timing).
  2. Write a minimal directed testbench that catches obvious polarity issues.
  3. Add randomized stimulus around legal operating bounds.
  4. Capture waveforms for one clean pass and one intentional failure case.

Example RTL slice

module pulse_counter (
  input  wire       clk,
  input  wire       rst_n,
  input  wire       pulse_in,
  output reg [7:0]  count
);
  always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
      count <= 8'd0;
    end else if (pulse_in) begin
      count <= count + 8'd1;
    end
  end
endmodule

The module is intentionally small, but the method scales. Interface stability plus early tests reduces late debug time during synthesis and implementation.
